recipes.name: Chicken Roast
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken pieces, yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and let marinate for at least 1 hour.
2. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken pieces and fry until golden brown and crispy on all sides.
3. Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Biriyani
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Wash the rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
2. In a large pot, heat the ghee over medium-high heat. Add the onions and sauté until golden brown.
3. Add the chicken pieces and fry until lightly browned.
4. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, bay leaves, cloves, cardamom pods, and salt. Mix well and fry for a few minutes.
5. Drain the rice and add it to the pot. Mix well.
6. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer until the rice is cooked and the water has been absorbed.
7. Serve hot with raita and salad.

recipes.name: Beef Bhuna
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the onions and sauté until golden brown.
2. Add the beef pieces and fry until lightly browned.
3. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and fry for a few minutes.
4. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they are soft and the beef is cooked through.
5. Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Aloo Posto
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Soak the poppy seeds in water for 30 minutes.
2. Drain the water and grind the poppy seeds with 2 tablespoons of water to make a paste.
3. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the potatoes until lightly browned.
4. Add the chopped green chilies, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and fry for a minute.
5. Add the poppy seed paste and mix well. Add a little water if needed to adjust the consistency.
6. Cover the pan and cook until the potatoes are tender and the poppy seed paste is cooked.
7. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Chana Masala
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onions and fry until golden brown.
2. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and fry for a minute.
3. Add the chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and the oil separates from the mixture.
4. Add the cooked chickpeas and mix well. Add water if needed to adjust the consistency.
5. Add garam masala and cook for 5-7 minutes.
6. Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Mutton Korma
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
2. Add the mutton pieces and fry until lightly browned.
3. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and fry for a few minutes.
4. Add the plain yogurt and mix well. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
5. Add garam masala and cook for another 5-7 minutes.
6. Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Chingri Malai Curry
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onions and fry until golden brown.
2. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and fry for a minute.
3. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they are soft.
4. Add the prawns and mix well. Add water if needed to adjust the consistency.
5. Add garam masala and cook for 5-7 minutes.
6. Add the coconut milk and cook for another 5-7 minutes.
7. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Biriyani
ingredients: 1 pound chicken or lamb, cut into pieces
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Soak the basmati rice in water for 30 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add the sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove the onions and keep aside.
3. Add the meat pieces and fry until lightly browned. Remove the meat and keep aside.
4. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and fry for a minute.
5. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they are soft.
6. Add the fried meat pieces and mix well. Add water if needed to adjust the consistency.
7. Add the plain yogurt and mix well. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
8. Add garam masala and cook for another 5-7 minutes.
9. Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pan. Mix well.
10. Add enough water to cook the rice and bring it to a boil. Cover the pan and cook on low heat until the rice is cooked.
11. Serve hot with the fried onions.

recipes.name: Dal
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Rinse the lentils and soak them in water for 30 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add the cumin seeds and fry for a few seconds.
3. Add the chopped onions and fry until golden brown.
4. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Mix well and fry for a minute.
5. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they are soft.
6. Drain the soaked lentils and add them to the pan. Mix well.
7. Add water and salt. Mix well and bring it to a boil.
8. Reduce the heat and simmer until the lentils are cooked.
9. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Kacchi Biryani
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Wash the rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
2. Heat clarified butter in a pan over medium-high heat. Add the sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove the onions and keep aside.
3. Add the mutton pieces and fry until lightly browned. Remove the mutton and keep aside.
4. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and fry for a minute.
5. Add the plain yogurt and mix well. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
6. Add the fried mutton pieces and mix well. Add water and cook until the mutton is tender.
7. Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pan. Mix well.
8. Add the garam masala and half of the fried onions. Mix well.
9. Add enough water to cook the rice and bring it to a boil. Cover the pan and cook on low heat until the rice is cooked.
10. Serve hot with the remaining fried onions.

recipes.name: Bhapa Ilish
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Clean the fish pieces and marinate with turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt for 10 minutes.
2. Take a bowl and add water, mustard oil, and green chilies. Mix well.
3. Place the marinated fish pieces in a dish and pour the mustard oil mixture over them. Cover the dish with aluminum foil.
4. Heat water in a steamer. Place the dish with the fish in the steamer and steam for 10-15 minutes.
5. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Fish Bhuna
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Clean the fish pieces and marinate with turmeric powder and salt for 10 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onions and fry until golden brown.
3. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Mix well and fry for a minute.
4. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they are soft.
5. Add the marinated fish pieces and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
6. Add water and salt. Mix well and bring it to a boil.
7. Reduce the heat and simmer until the fish is cooked.
8. Garnish with coriander leaves.
9. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Morog Pulao
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Wash the rice and soak in water for 30 minutes.
2. Heat ghee in a pan over medium heat. Fry the sliced onion until golden brown. Remove from the pan and keep aside.
3. In the same pan, add the chicken pieces and fry until golden brown.
4. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and fry for a few minutes.
5. Add 4 cups of water and bring it to a boil.
6. Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pan. Mix well.
7. Cover the pan and cook over low heat until the rice and chicken are cooked.
8. In a small bowl, mix saffron with milk and pour over the rice. Mix gently.
9. Garnish with fried onions, cashews, and raisins.
10. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Chitol Macher Muitha
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Soak chana dal in water for 2-3 hours.
2. Drain the water and grind the dal to a smooth paste.
3. Add the boneless Chitol fish and mix well.
4. Add chopped onions, ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
5. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Shape the mixture into small balls and add to the pan.
6. Fry the balls until golden brown on all sides.
7. Remove the balls from the pan and keep aside.
8. In the same pan, add water and bring it to a boil.
9. Add the fried balls and cook for 10-15 minutes.
10. Garnish with coriander leaves.
11. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Bhapa Ilish
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Clean the fish pieces and marinate with turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt for 10 minutes.
2. Take a bowl and add water, mustard oil, and green chilies. Mix well.
3. Place the marinated fish pieces in a dish and pour the mustard oil mixture over them. Cover the dish with aluminum foil.
4. Heat water in a steamer. Place the dish with the fish in the steamer and steam for 10-15 minutes.
5. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Fish Bhuna
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Clean the fish pieces and marinate with turmeric powder and salt for 10 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onions and fry until golden brown.
3. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Mix well and fry for a minute.
4. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they are soft.
5. Add the marinated fish pieces and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
6. Add water and salt. Mix well and bring it to a boil.
7. Reduce the heat and simmer until the fish is cooked.
8. Garnish with coriander leaves.
9. Serve hot with rice.

2. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken pieces and fry until golden brown and crispy on all sides.
3. Serve hot with rice or naan.

4. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, bay leaves, cloves, cardamom pods, and salt. Mix well and fry for a few minutes.
